channel.title: Whats wrong with this magical pool?

item.title: Whats wrong with this magical pool?
item.dc:creator: @Lets_PK Lets PK
item.description:
@Lets_PK wrote:

100,000ms is 100 seconds (1 minute, 40 seconds).

I notice my times are wrong, its just it does not get the last moved action and lets you use the portal(even when waling 5 sqs to the portal)

Read full topic

10000 = 10 secs[/quote]
i did have the timer at 100000 - i think thats 1 minute, and still didnt work correctly…

item.title: Whats wrong with this magical pool?
item.dc:creator: @Lets_PK Lets PK
item.description:
@Lets_PK wrote:

the timers dont work correctly + When i up the timer to 10000 u have to wait outside wildy too, Could anyone fix this up for me please

Thanks for looking

[code]public void handleTeleporting() //new telepool
{
String[] main = { “Edgeville”, “Castle”, “Zombies”, “Altar”, “Dragon Maze”, “Mage Arena” };
owner.setMenuHandler(new MenuHandler(main) {

public void handleReply(int option, String response)
{
while(System.currentTimeMillis() - owner.getLastMoved() < 1000)
{
owner.getActionSender().sendMessage(“You got to stand still for 1 minutes in order to use the poral”);
return;
}
while(System.currentTimeMillis() - owner.getCombatTimer() < 1000)
{
owner.getActionSender().sendMessage(“You must not be in combat for atleast 1 minute before you can teleport”);
return;
}

if(option == 0) {
owner.setLocation(Point.location(208, 451), true);
owner.resetPath();

}else
if(option == 1) {
owner.setLocation(Point.location(271, 355), true);
owner.resetPath();

}else
if(option == 2) {
owner.setLocation(Point.location(154, 322), true);
owner.resetPath();

}else
if(option == 3) {
owner.setLocation(Point.location(321, 201), true);
owner.resetPath();

}else
if(option == 4) {
owner.setLocation(Point.location(270, 195), true);
owner.resetPath();

}else
if(option == 5) {
owner.setLocation(Point.location(222, 110), true);
owner.resetPath();
}

}});[/code]

Read full topic
